1170491.name: crocheted menstrual cup
1170491.notes_html:
pattern for a crocheted menstrual cup. i made this with a 2.5 mm hook and it ended up about 8 cm long, with a diameter of just under 4 cm at its widest point. of course, the pattern would work just as well with a different sized hook (but the size of the cup would change accordingly).

DECORATIVE ONLY! this is in the medical category because it seemed like the most relevant one from the options. it’s not meant to be usable. sorry there has been confusion over this!

if you have any questions about the pattern, please feel free to contact me, either on here, on Ribblr, or on instagram @kadedoescrochet. you’re welcome to sell items made from this pattern, providing that they are handmade and not mass-produced, and that you credit me. i do NOT give permission for the pattern itself to be shared. an example of an acceptable way to credit me would be to add the following onto your item description: “This item was made from a pattern by Kade Bagnall-Oakeley, instagram, Ribblr and Facebook @kadedoescrochet.”

if you make anything from this pattern, please tag me etc! i would love to see :))

1183889.name: Cozy Kitty Heating Pad
1183889.gauge_description: 13 stitches and 14 rows = 4 inches in single crochet
1183889.notes_html:
Everyone loves a good heating pad, especially as we move into the colder months! Heating pads are great for sore muscles, cramps, and other aches and pains, as well as just being great to snuggle up with for extra warmth. The Cozy Kitty Heating Pad is designed to do all of that, in addition to being irresistibly ADORABLE. These heating pads are great to have around the house and make excellent gifts for the cat-lovers in your life.

The finished product is a 6 inch x 8 inch, 100% microwave-safe heating pad. This hot/cold pack can be microwaved for 30 seconds at a time, for up to two minutes, or until desired temperature is reached.

This pattern features:

  • step by step instructions, with photos
  • beginner-friendly crochet techniques
  • quick and easy pattern (takes about 1.5 hours to make)
  • easy to customize - choose your favorite cotton yarn for this project!

Materials needed:

  • 5 mm crochet hook
  • 110 yards of 100% cotton yarn
  • 2 yards of contrasting 100% cotton yarn
  • cotton fabric
  • approx. 2 cups of dry rice
  • sewing thread
  • sewing needle
  • tapestry needle

This pattern is 9 pages and includes color photos to help with the more technical aspects of the pattern. This pattern does require some very basic sewing skills (I.e. can you sew two pieces of fabric together), so even the most novice seamster/seamstress can create this pattern. The pattern will be available for instant download once payment is received. This pattern is written in English only using American terminology.

1186450.name: Midwifery Boobs
1186450.sizes_available: Multiple sizes possible. DK Small = 8-9" (20-23cm) circumference & 2.5" (6cm) tall. DK Large = 10.5-12" (27-30cm) circumference & 3.5" (9cm) tall.
1186450.notes_html:
Looking for quick and easy crochet project to gift your midwife and doula friends? Try this midwifery boob pattern!

With flexible pinchy/invertable nipples, these boobs are the perfect teaching tool for midwives and doulas to demonstrate how nipples can become pinched with a shallow latch, how a baby should latch onto the breast and how to hand express.

Written instructions include how to crochet an assortment of boobs like pictured.

Perfect gift for midwifery students!

Available in Two Formats:

  • 6-page, ad-free, printer friendly PDF digital download - ONLY $1.75! Available in both US and UK terminology options.

  • FREE on my blog! US terminology only.

Sizing & Gauge:

DK yarn with a 3.25mm or 3.5mm hook is recommended for best results for invertable nipples. However, you are welcome to use any yarn weight you like, just ensure your stitches are tight!

If you use Sport of WW, you may not need to make any adjustments to the pattern. However if you choose a finer weight yarn/thread, you make need to implement more increase rows on the nipple to make it invertable.

Note: Sizes above are approximates. Your sizing may differ depending on your chosen yarn, hook size and tension. Adjust these factors to get desired size.

These patterns are copyrighted to Rebeckah Ferger, however, you are more than welcome to sell what you make from them. If you sell what you make online, please link back to www.rebeckahstreasures.com and give pattern credit to Rebeckah’s Treasures. Thank you!

If you use Sport of WW, you may not need to make any adjustments to the pattern. However if you choose a finer weight yarn/thread, you make need to implement more increase rows on the nipple to make it invertable.

**Note:** Sizes above are approximates. Your sizing may differ depending on your chosen yarn, hook size and tension. Adjust these factors to get desired size.

pattern_author.name: Rebeckah Ferger
pattern_author.notes: Hi, my name is Rebeckah! I am a Canadian/Norwegian currently preparing to undergo Midwifery training. My mother taught me the basic crochet stitches when I was 10, and from there, I began crocheting simple clothes for my barbie dolls. As my skills developed, I got into crocheting more elaborate barbie doll designs, only this time the finished creations were for my younger sisters. In my teens, I branched out into other areas such as accessories, bags, wallets, baby layettes, and other toys. Towards the end of 2012, I started working on my website. In March 2013, I finally published it, so I could share my hobby with the world. Although, I enjoy exploring new ideas and crochet techniques, my first love is and always will be designing fashion doll sets. So, you'll see a lot of my designs find fun ways to incorporate them. I love crocheting unique treasures, and making people happy with my creations! I hope you will enjoy them too through my patterns. If you would like to read more about my creations, please visit my webpage http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com **Share what you're making...** Join my Crocheting Treasures Ravelry Group http://www.ravelry.com/groups/crocheting-treasures > **Loyalty Program + Special Offers:** > > * **20% discount** when you purchase > **4** crochet patterns together! Use the code "**LOYAL20**" at checkout. > > * Receive a **FREE** [Loyalty Program Crochet Pattern][7] for Every $10.00 > in accumulative pattern purchases! Use the code > "**LOYAL10**" at checkout. > > * Receive a **$5.00 OFF** your order for Every $30.00 in accumulative pattern purchases! > Use the code "**LOYAL30**" at > checkout. > > * Receive a **FREE** Crochet Pattern of your choosing for Every $50.00 in > accumulative pattern purchases! Use the code > "**LOYAL50**" at checkout. > > Learn more about [loyalty crochet > patterns here][8]. Plus, you won't > want to miss these [special bundle > packages][9]! **Be Sure to Follow Me on My Social Sites too, so you never miss a thing:** https://www.facebook.com/RebeckahsTreasures https://plus.google.com/b/105720787391241869524/+Rebeckahstreasures/posts https://www.instagram.com/beckastreasures/ http://www.pinterest.com/rebeckahferger/ https://twitter.com/beckastreasures https://www.youtube.com/user/RebeckahsTreasures ---------------------------------------- [1]: www.rebeckahstreasures.com [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/crocheting-treasures [3]: http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/3-for-5-pattern-pack.html [4]: http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/10-for-10-pattern-pack.html [5]: http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/25-for-20-pattern-pack.html [6]: http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/40-for-30-pattern-pack.html [7]: http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/list-of-loyalty-program-patterns.html [8]: http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/loyalty-program.html [9]: http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/special-offers.html [10]: hhttp://www.rebeckahstreasures.com/blog/st-pattys-2017-4th-blog-anniversary-sweepstakes-sale
pattern_author.notes_html:
Hi, my name is Rebeckah! I am a Canadian/Norwegian currently preparing to undergo Midwifery training.

My mother taught me the basic crochet stitches when I was 10, and from there, I began crocheting simple clothes for my barbie dolls. As my skills developed, I got into crocheting more elaborate barbie doll designs, only this time the finished creations were for my younger sisters.

In my teens, I branched out into other areas such as accessories, bags, wallets, baby layettes, and other toys. Towards the end of 2012, I started working on my website. In March 2013, I finally published it, so I could share my hobby with the world.

Although, I enjoy exploring new ideas and crochet techniques, my first love is and always will be designing fashion doll sets. So, you’ll see a lot of my designs find fun ways to incorporate them.

I love crocheting unique treasures, and making people happy with my creations! I hope you will enjoy them too through my patterns.

If you would like to read more about my creations, please visit my webpage http://www.rebeckahstreasures.com

Share what you’re making… Join my Crocheting Treasures Ravelry Group
http://www.ravelry.com/groups/crocheting-treasures

Loyalty Program + Special Offers:

  • 20% discount when you purchase 4 crochet patterns together! Use the code “LOYAL20” at checkout.

  • Receive a FREE Loyalty Program Crochet Pattern for Every $10.00 in accumulative pattern purchases! Use the code “LOYAL10” at checkout.

  • Receive a $5.00 OFF your order for Every $30.00 in accumulative pattern purchases! Use the code “LOYAL30” at checkout.

  • Receive a FREE Crochet Pattern of your choosing for Every $50.00 in accumulative pattern purchases! Use the code “LOYAL50” at checkout.

Learn more about loyalty crochet patterns here. Plus, you won’t want to miss these special bundle packages!

Be Sure to Follow Me on My Social Sites too, so you never miss a thing:

1226142.name: Rainbow Crochet Cord Tie
1226142.notes_html:
A lovely rainbow crochet cord tie pattern.

Supplies: 5 Balls of Cotton in different colours.
3mm Hook

This digital download includes the same pattern written US and UK crochet terms.

For accuracy using this pattern please use the yarn stated, this pattern also suggests other suitable yarns.

This pattern is written in standard American and UK terms using SC, DC, TR, MAGIC RING, INC so an understanding of these terms is useful but if you get stuck you can always contact me for help and Youtube has a large collection of tutorials useful for teaching certain stitches.

This is a Digital Download.

1235940.gauge_pattern: 5 modified sedge clusters x 7 rows = 5cm x 4cm
1235940.name: Crutches Cover
1235940.gauge_description: 5 modified sedge clusters x 7 rows = 5cm x 4cm
1235940.notes_html:
This crochet pattern makes a set of crutches covers that go over standard size foam/PVC pads commonly found online. Do note that covers made from this pattern will be too large if used over crutches without the pads.

Gauge

5 modified sedge clusters x 7 rows = 5cm x 4cm
Gauge swatch is worked in rows but pattern is worked in rounds

ch 11
Row 1: (sc, dc) into the 3rd ch from hook, skip 1, (sc, dc)* repeat till end of row, ch 1

Rows 2-7: (sc, dc) into the 1st st, skip 1, (sc, dc)* till end of row
1235940.notes:
This crochet pattern makes a set of crutches covers that go over standard size foam/PVC pads commonly found online. Do note that covers made from this pattern will be too large if used over crutches without the pads. 

**Gauge**

5 modified sedge clusters x 7 rows = 5cm x 4cm
Gauge swatch is worked in rows but pattern is worked in rounds
 
ch 11
Row 1: (sc, dc) into the 3rd ch from hook, [ skip 1, (sc, dc) ]* repeat till end of row, ch 1

Rows 2-7: (sc, dc) into the 1st st,  [ skip 1, (sc, dc) ]* till end of row

pattern_author.name: Jocelyn Ng
pattern_author.notes:
Hello! I'm Joce and I design crochet wearables. Connect with me on instagram [@offhook.creations][1] 

I live in sunny Singapore. I've always been an avid crafter since my youth. I started crocheting in 2020 and found the passion and drive to continue crafting more consistently. Shortly after, I picked up knitting and now I can't live without either of them 

I enjoy making feminine designs that are also practical enough that I see myself wearing them. Customizability is a strong theme across my patterns. I recognize that all bodies are different and I hope to make my patterns as accessible as possible to everyone❣️

You are not alone in your crochet journey, 
so feel free to reach out to me if you ever have questions about my patterns! 

Happy making!
<3 Joce

Find my patterns on: [Etsy][3] | [LoveCrafts][4] | [Ribblr][5]


  [1]: https://www.instagram.com/offhook.creations
  [2]: https://offhook.joceyng.com/tips-tricks?campaign=offhookpatterns&utm_term=RavelryProfile
  [3]: https://www.etsy.com/sg-en/shop/OffhookCrochet
[4]: https://www.lovecrafts.com/en-gb/user/maker/0da851eb-fd5a-4513-93ac-06c03ce3936a
[5]: https://ribblr.com/shop/offhook-creations/?referrer=19819

1279258.name: Knotty Knockers
1279258.gauge_description: 23 stitches and 20 rows = 4 inches in Sc
1279258.notes_html:
#BreastCancerAwarenessMonth

These crochet knockers are a great alternative to prosthetic breasts. They are light and breathable and ergonomically shaped.

Yarn weight: Category 3
Brand: Lion Brand Coboo
Color: Pink & Tan
Hook: 2.5mm
Gauge: 23 Sc Sts x 20 Rows = 4”x 4”
No. Skeins for Yarn A: 1 for all sizes.
No. Skeins for Yarn B: A/B/C/D – 1/ 1/ 1/ 1
Tools: tapestry needle, measuring tape, scissors, Stitch markers, Fiber Fill Stuffing
Skill: Easy

Note:
Prepare gauge to get the right size. You may need to adjust your tension or hook size to obtain the same gauge
Yarn A refers to Center or Nipple yarn, Yarn B refers to Skin tone Yarn
Abbreviation available in English US format

Cup sizes: A/B/C/D – 6/ 7/ 8/ 9 in or 15.2/ 17.8/ 20.3/ 22.9 cm
Knotty Knockers in images are made in cup size B for reference

Free Pattern available
1279258.notes:
#BreastCancerAwarenessMonth

These crochet knockers are a great alternative to prosthetic breasts. They are light and breathable and ergonomically shaped.

Yarn weight: Category 3
Brand: Lion Brand Coboo
Color: Pink & Tan
Hook: 2.5mm
Gauge: 23 Sc Sts x 20 Rows = 4”x 4”
No. Skeins for Yarn A: 1 for all sizes.
No. Skeins for Yarn B: [A/B/C/D] [E/ F/ G/H] – [1/ 1/ 1/ 1] [1/ 2/ 2/ 2] 
Tools: tapestry needle, measuring tape, scissors, Stitch markers, Fiber Fill Stuffing
Skill: Easy

Note:
Prepare gauge to get the right size. You may need to adjust your tension or hook size to obtain the same gauge
Yarn A refers to Center or Nipple yarn, Yarn B refers to Skin tone Yarn
Abbreviation available in English US format 

Cup sizes: [A/B/C/D] [E/ F/ G/H] –  [6/ 7/ 8/ 9] [10/ 11/ 12/ 13] in or [15.2/ 17.8/ 20.3/ 22.9] [25.4/ 27.9/ 30.5/ 33.0] cm 
Knotty Knockers in images are made in cup size B for reference

Free Pattern available

pattern_author.name: Shaz
pattern_author.notes:
‍♀️ Hi everyone, my name is Sharon - just a simple gal who enjoys designing crochet beachwear and summerwear and beyond

A mom of 2 toddler boys and a food enthusiast! 

Crochet Updates:
Selling handmade crochet bikinis from 2013 - 2017.
Selling crochet patterns from 2018 - 2021
Offering free crochet patterns that are size inclusive 2021 ->

Currently residing in Seattle, If I’m not on my hook then you’ll see me at the park/ playground/ beach with the kids or watching a good movie at home with the hubby.
I hope you enjoy my designs :)

Shaz
pattern_author.notes_html:
‍♀️ Hi everyone, my name is Sharon - just a simple gal who enjoys designing crochet beachwear and summerwear and beyond

A mom of 2 toddler boys and a food enthusiast!

Crochet Updates:
Selling handmade crochet bikinis from 2013 - 2017.
Selling crochet patterns from 2018 - 2021
Offering free crochet patterns that are size inclusive 2021 ->

Currently residing in Seattle, If I’m not on my hook then you’ll see me at the park/ playground/ beach with the kids or watching a good movie at home with the hubby.
I hope you enjoy my designs :)

Shaz

1331393.name: eye patch
1331393.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
1331393.notes_html:
Guide, rather than full pattern
Used next-to-no yarn, guessing 20meters?
Need hook, yarn, needle scissors. May also want elastic and sewing thread and needle

Was made to accommodate Mums skewed eye that she can see out of, but is currently stuck in one position and irritates her. Couldn’t find a patch pattern anywhere that wasn’t flat and cartoon-y or even looked comfortable to wear, and bought ones are either rubbish or expensive

This is somewhat a work in progress, so all suggestions welcome. I’ve also never written a pattern before, so I hope it’s understandable.
Good luck?

Edit(note?): Mums taken to wearing them over her glasses, because she can position exactly where needed. Which is shown in photos.

1332950.name: Stump Warmer (Second World War)
1332950.notes_html:
Amputation Leg Cover.

Decreasing rows are spaced unevenly so that ridges are not formed. The article must not have ridges of any kind as this can cause pressure and sores on the fragile skin.

The finishing must be flat to prevent rubbing on the wound.
1332950.notes:
Amputation Leg Cover.

*Decreasing rows are spaced unevenly so that ridges are not formed. The article must not have ridges of any kind as this can cause pressure and sores on the fragile skin.*

*The finishing must be flat to prevent rubbing on the wound.*

1342261.name: Preemie IV Sleeve
1342261.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 8 rows = 4 inches in 20 st x 8 rows = 4"
1342261.notes_html:
The Preemie IV Sleeve crochet pattern is a design that is good for preemie babies who need special care and may need an IV or Canual line for medication.

The sleeve is a way to protect the baby from scratches and to hold the line in place. This crochet pattern would be great to donate to NICU wards of your local hospital or a donation center.

I used I Love This Yarn. #2 ply Sport Weight Yarn (230 yds/210 meter) (2.5 oz/71 g)

Size: 6” x 2”

Materials:
3-10 yds of #2 ply Sports Weight Yarn
US E or 3.25 mm Crochet Hook
Scissors
Tapestry Needle
Stitch Marker
1342261.notes:

Size:  6” x 2”


Materials:

users.about_me:
My family is very supportive since I have started my crochet journey. They have become more involved in my business.  My hubby is my photographer, my crochet pattern critic, and my set designer.  My son has become my marketing advisor and now he is working on designing crochet patterns by giving me ideas and steps along the way.

In late 2018 I started designing my own crochet patterns.  I started out doing hats and scarves and smaller items.


In the last 5 years of designing my own crochet patterns I have been learning new crochet stitches and incorporating them in my crochet designs for you to do and learn. 

In 2023 I am designing a wider variety of crochet patterns.  I have been designing pet items, baby clothes, new women's accessories and crochet patterns just for men.

In the last year I have gained more followers, supporters, and lovers of my crochet designs.  I have also gained some awesome friends along the way!

1344388.name: Uterus Model
1344388.notes_html: Birth education uterus model. This version includes a button close, c-section pocket. Meant to be used with baby and placenta for birth classes or the like.
1344388.notes: Birth education uterus model. This version includes a button close, c-section pocket. Meant to be used with baby and placenta for birth classes or the like.

1363951.name: Dilation Model
1363951.notes_html: Dilation model pattern. Birth education tool, showing cervical dilation from 1cm to 10cm. 4mm hook and basic stitch knowledge as well as forward crab stitch mastery.
1363951.notes: Dilation model pattern. Birth education tool, showing cervical dilation from 1cm to 10cm. 4mm hook and basic stitch knowledge as well as forward crab stitch mastery.

1364738.name: CSM Knitted Knockers
1364738.notes_html:
Knitted Knockers are special handmade breast prostheses for women who have had breast cancer and undergone mastectomy or lumpectomy. Traditional breast prosthetics can be hot, heavy and sticky. They typically require special bras or camisoles with pockets and can’t be worn for weeks after surgery. Knitted Knockers are soft, comfortable, beautiful and when placed in a regular bra they take the shape and feel of a real breast. They are adjustable, washable and can even be worn while swimming. Volunteer knitters provide these FREE to those requesting them.

Please note, this pattern is not an officially approved pat tern so will not be accepted for distribution by Knitted Knockers Support Foundation, (knittedknockers.org). However, this pattern closely matches the hand knit version and could be used for anyone you want to make them personally for.

Any cylinder will work. You will be using anywhere between 30-40 slots of the cylinder depending on the cup size. You can leave all of the needles in the machine and raise the ones that will not be used or work using a flat panel with the excess needles taken out. The photos shown were made with all the needles in the cylinder except for the one that is taken out to make “purl” ridge. Each row has a number in parenthesis that indicates how many slots are working (including the purl ridge)
1364738.notes:
Knitted Knockers are special handmade breast prostheses for women who have had breast cancer and undergone mastectomy or lumpectomy. Traditional breast prosthetics can be hot, heavy and sticky. They typically require special bras or camisoles with pockets and can’t be worn for weeks after surgery. Knitted Knockers are soft, comfortable, beautiful and when placed in a regular bra they take the shape and feel of a real breast. They are adjustable, washable and can even be worn while swimming. Volunteer knitters provide these FREE to those requesting them.

Please note, this pattern is not an officially approved pat tern so will not be accepted for distribution by Knitted Knockers Support Foundation, (knittedknockers.org). However, this pattern closely matches the hand knit version and could be used for anyone you want to make them personally for.

Any cylinder will work. You will be using anywhere between 30-40 slots of the cylinder depending on the cup size. You can leave all of the needles in the machine and raise the ones that will not be used or work using a flat panel with the excess needles taken out. The photos shown were made with all the needles in the cylinder except for the one that is taken out to make “purl” ridge. Each row has a number in parenthesis that indicates how many slots are working (including the purl ridge)

1365067.name: Breast Model
1365067.notes_html:
The perfect model for lactation consultants and classes.

This crochet patterns contains instruction with step-by-step on how to make Breast Model.
All the instructions are made in English (US).

To create such ornament you shall know how to make:

MR – magic ring
sc – single crochet
Sl st – slip stitch
dec – decrease
inc – increase

Materials:

  1. Any yarn, I used YarnArt Jeans(50gr/160m/174yds): beige №07, white № 62.
  2. Crochet hook 2 mm.
  3. Fiberfill/stuffing, thick sewing needle, pins, scissors and a good mood.
1365067.notes:

2. Crochet hook 2 mm.
3. Fiberfill/stuffing, thick sewing needle, pins, scissors and a good mood.

7322054.name: Artificial Breast
7322054.notes_html: This is a crochet pattern for an artificial breast that sits inside your bra. A dear loved one lost one of her breasts to cancer and after searching and searching for a pattern, with no luck, I decided to make one. When finished, the artificial breast will measure around 4 and ½ inches wide by 3 inches tall. If you decide to use a different size hook or different weight yarn, there will be some variance to the size. It includes a peak resembling a nipple and a flat bottom to sit more comfortably on a person’s chest. Cancer is a horrible disease. Every person affected is brave and beautiful and deserves to feel brave and beautiful. I hope this pattern helps <3
7322054.notes: This is a crochet pattern for an artificial breast that sits inside your bra. When finished, the artificial breast will measure around 4 and ½ inches wide by 3 inches tall. If you decide to use a different size hook or different weight yarn, there will be some variance to the size. It includes a peak resembling a nipple and a flat bottom to sit more comfortably on a person's chest. Cancer is a horrible disease. Every person affected is brave and beautiful and deserves to feel brave and beautiful. I hope this pattern helps <3

7335885.name: Retention Bandage (Knitted)
7335885.notes_html:
THIS IS THE KNITTED PATTERN.

These cotton retention bandages may be used for medical conditions with chronic skin ulcers which need regular wound care. It can be washed and reused. It is an alternative to disposable store-bought bandages.

Please secure your doctor’s/health provider’s approval before using these bandages.

BACKGROUND

On April 4, 2024 I posted a request on Facebook and Instagram for help with this project. In truth, I had expected only a few to come forward. I never expected thousands of knitters and crocheters to offer their help.

I am very grateful for many, many kind individuals.

These cotton retention bandages are reusable bandages that are placed over the primary wound dressing. These are for our patients with Leprosy (Hansen’s disease) who have chronic, non-healing wounds. They are patients at the University of the Philippines-Philippine General Hospital (UP-PGH) Department of Dermatology.

OVERVIEW
Please be guided by the following:
-please use only 100% cotton or mercerized cotton, lace weight (CYC #0), 26-27 wraps per inch (WPI). These are bandages for medical use and must be thin.
-please DO NOT use any synthetic fiber (no acrylic, cotton blends, polyester, raylon, milk cotton, poly cotton, lanalon, indophil)
-undyed, bare, white, cream, natural, and off-white only (no color dyes which can potentially irritate open wounds )

THREAD
-for those who live in the Philippines – Monaco mercerized cotton 3-ply balls or cone, Cannon mercerized cotton 3-ply ball or cone, Monaco CCK83 mercerized cotton 3-ply cone
-for those who live in other countries – cotton crochet thread size 10. A list of suggested thread/yarn is included in the pattern. It will be updated as often as necessary. The updated list will also be posted in the Knits by May Facebook group under the Guides tab - Retention Bandages https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/

-the gauge is not important. Please adjust the size of your knitting needles or crochet hook depending on your personal gauge/tension to produce the right fabric.

I have set up chat groups within a Facebook group for updates and to answer your questions. Joining the Knits by May Facebook group and the chat group is purely voluntary. The link to the group is https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/ then join the chat for your location.

As of April 2024, there are two chats (PH and Worldwide). In the Worldwide chat there are side chats for US/Canada and Australia/New Zealand.

Many, many thanks to Ariett07 for converting the hand-knitting pattern into a machine-knitting pattern.

Thank you all for your generosity and willingness to share your time and your talent.

Dr. May

—-

June 2024 update

  • includes option for 4-inch wide bandages
  • additional thread options

THIS IS THE KNITTED PATTERN.

These cotton retention bandages may be used for medical conditions with chronic skin ulcers which need regular wound care. It can be washed and reused. It is an alternative to disposable store-bought bandages.

Please secure your doctor’s/health provider’s approval before using these bandages.

------ 

BACKGROUND

On April 4, 2024 I posted a request on Facebook and Instagram for help with this project. In truth, I had expected only a few to come forward. I never expected thousands of knitters and crocheters to offer their help. 

I am very grateful for many, many kind individuals.

These cotton retention bandages are reusable bandages that are placed over the primary wound dressing. These are for our patients with Leprosy (Hansen’s disease) who have chronic, non-healing wounds. They are patients at the University of the Philippines-Philippine General Hospital (UP-PGH) Department of Dermatology.


OVERVIEW
Please be guided by the following:
-please use only 100% cotton or mercerized cotton, lace weight (CYC #0), 26-27 wraps per inch (WPI). These are bandages for medical use and must be thin.
-please DO NOT use any synthetic fiber (no acrylic, cotton blends, polyester, raylon, milk cotton, poly cotton, lanalon, indophil)
-undyed, bare, white, cream, natural, and off-white only (no color dyes which can potentially irritate open wounds )

THREAD
-for those who live in the Philippines – Monaco mercerized cotton 3-ply balls or cone, Cannon mercerized cotton 3-ply ball or cone, Monaco CCK83 mercerized cotton 3-ply cone 
-for those who live in other countries – cotton crochet thread size 10. A list of suggested thread/yarn is included in the pattern. It will be updated as often as necessary. The updated list will also be posted in the Knits by May Facebook group under the Guides tab - Retention Bandages https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/ 

-the gauge is not important. Please adjust the size of your knitting needles or crochet hook depending on your personal gauge/tension to produce the right fabric.


I have set up chat groups within a Facebook group for updates and to answer your questions. Joining the Knits by May Facebook group and the chat group is purely voluntary. The link to the group is https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/ then join the chat for your location. 

As of April 2024, there are two chats (PH and Worldwide). In the Worldwide chat there are side chats for US/Canada and Australia/New Zealand. 

Many, many thanks to Ariett07 for converting the hand-knitting pattern into a machine-knitting pattern.

Thank you all for your generosity and willingness to share your time and your talent.


Dr. May 

—- 

June 2024 update
- includes option for 4-inch wide bandages
- additional thread options
